content.description:
The figure above is the graph of a function of x, which models the height of a skateboard ramp. The function meets the following requirements.

(i) At x=0, the value of the function is 0, and the slope of the graph of the function is 0.

(ii) At x=4, the value of the function is 1, and the slope of the graph of the function is 1.

(iii) Between x=0 and x=4, the function is increasing.
content.question: Using the function g and your value of c from part (b), show that g does not meet requirement (iii) above.

frqParts.text: Using the function g and your value of c from part (b), show that g does not meet requirement (iii) above.

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
